subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-ŋa-k||forehead; cockscomb}}.

This word is only attested during {{w|Han Dynasty|Han}} and later. {{zh-ref|Wang (1982)}} suggested that it is cognate with {{och-l|顏|face}}, whereas {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} considers it a semantic extension of {{och-l|詻|to face}}.

The relationship to {{cog|mkh-pro|*(t₁)ʔah|*[t₁]ʔah|forehead}}, whence {{cog|km|ថ្ងាស}}, is unclear.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=é
|m-s=nge2
|c=ngaak6,ngaak6-2
|c_note=ngaak6-2 - “top part, board, amount”
|h=pfs=ngiak
|md=ngiăh>ngiĕh/ngiăh
|md_note=ngiăh>ngiĕh - “forehead”; ngiăh - “top part, board, amount”
|mn=hia̍h/gia̍h/xm,zz,tw:ge̍k/qz:gia̍k
|mn_note=hia̍h - vernacular (“forehead, top part, board”); gia̍h - vernacular (“amount”); ge̍k/gia̍k - literary
|w=5ngaq
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n
}}
